I figured that's probably the case (i know it's been a requested feature to make nested content easier to work with).
We'll see what the end result becomes :beers:

Wasn't sure of a better place to put this. 
HS team it'd be good if we could get patches to the jquery implementations HS requires. Granted, this issue shouldn't really affect much on a HS site. <https://www.zdnet.com/article/popular-jquery-javascript-library-impacted-by-prototype-pollution-flaw/>
/poll "Would you like to use AMP stories as a module in HS <https://amp.dev/about/stories?referrer=ampproject.org>" "Yes" "No"
How long does it usually take for HubSpot to recache a stylesheet to the .min.css version?

Varies, but usually succeeds within a few days from last css file updating. They have auto testing tools that check whether combining the files would cause issues. Minifying itself should happen within minutes but if you have certain strings in your CSS file it will fail to play it safe. The minifier doesnt like @supports any values that include `0s`
Good place to repost that question: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Lead-Capture-Tools/bd-p/marketing_conversion> <@UG8BB9A90> - might get some answers there too.

i am having an issue providing a user updated permissions. i have make them a superadmin and they are still unable to create website pages. I have had them log out and back in and still nothing.

I think the user should wait for few mins.
I had this issue before.
Yup, the issue resolved after about 5 min
